brewery.brewery_description:
NZ's champion small brewery of 2021 is perched atop a small shelf on the south face of Double Cone. Here we brew our beers from the snow melt that surrounds us and utilise the perfect fermentation temperatures we find in the small crevices we call home. 

Each keg is then brought down from the peak by fixed ropes and then skied down to the Kawarau for delivery by raft. 

Whilst the above process might take a while and could possibly be stretching the truth...we believe that every beer should be an adventure. We brew for the love of it and the love of our people and environment.

beer.beer_name: Extra Dose: Cinnamon Roll Golden Stout
DDH Bill Us For the Damages [NZ Brewed]

location.venue_state: จังหวัดจันทบุรี

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy

beer.beer_description: Collaboration No. 3 with Heyday Beer Co from Wellington brings us a winter warmer of ultra-traditional heritage. Brewed on the winter solstice of 2024 this is a rich and malt forward Pale Ale for sipping on dark winter evenings. A traditional French farmhouse style usually brewed in winter and bottle-aged until the following winter or even longer for full maturation and enjoyment. Our version is dark copper in colour and incorporates three different rye malts giving a spicy dry feel to this beautiful style. Drink now or keep for up to 3 years.

items.badge_description: Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 45 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand. Try 5 more for Level 10.

beer.beer_description: Queenstown's own signature brew. Easy as and super refreshing.

What is a cold IPA. What is this new thing tagged 'IPA'? All beer should be cold right...? We are not the first to do this style - Invented in the pacific north west it is a re-invention of the west coast IPA. This is our 2nd iteration of the style as the first was a such a hit and we like this one more! Pouring a perfect clear pale yellow this IPA is fermented cold giving it a very light and dry body that makes this beer incredibly crisp and like the first brew its cleaner than a Singaporean bus station. Enhancing this crispiness is a smooth yet prominent, tongue coating bitterness giving length to the west coast style. At 6 percent we have dialed back the abv from the first brew and this time hopped it with mosaic and motueka giving a dank tropical aroma that jumps from the glass.

location.venue_state: กรุงเทพมหานคร

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 205 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 42!

items.checkin_comment: Feeling a bit thin there’s nice flavors

beer.beer_description: Beervana 2023. For those of you that dont know a Croquembouche - get googling. This showpiece is the ultimate test of a pastry chefs talents and that is exactly what we are going for. Sitting on a huge soft sweet base of malt and milk sugar is all the flavours and aromas of this magnificent dessert. Inhale layers of caramel and hazelnut praline and find nuances of subtle chocolate cream and milky coffee. Drink in a smooth, complex and mouthfilling synergy of craftsmanship and embrace the sweet richness and bold flavours that define this style.

beer.beer_name: Extra Dose: Cinnamon Roll Golden Stout
beer.beer_description: Pre-eminent Sydney brewers One Drop are synonymous with out the gate beer creations. After our individual beers combined for 1st, 2nd and 3rd at Beervana 2023 we just had to join forces to break the 2024 festival. Introducing our most decadent beer to date...a liquid freshly baked cinnamon roll. Made with mountains of caramel and biscuit malts, imported vanilla beans and gently toasted cinnamon sticks, then conditioned with marshmallows and hints of cold brewed coffee. Nothing short of astonishing to smell and taste, it's like transporting yourself to a Swedish bakery on a Saturday morning.

items.badge_description: You don't always intend to go for beers with a double digit ABV, but when you do, you make it count! Cheers to you, but be careful, 10% and up can really pack a punch. That's 150 different beers with an ABV of 10% and up. Try 5 more for Level 31!

Porters and Stouts are rich with both history and flavor. Roasty, dark, and delicious, these two styles helped start it all. That’s 105 different beers with the style of Porter or Stout. Try 5 more for Level 22!

Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 85 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand. Try 5 more for Level 18.

items.checkin_comment:
Good milkshake. Fruity, sweet and creamy.

Good work.

items.badge_description: Milkshake IPAs and Pale Ales are one of the trendiest styles right now. Who knew fruit, lactose, and hops would blend so well together?  You’ve checked-in to 25 different Milkshake style IPA’s or Pale Ales. Try 5 more for Level 6!

items.checkin_comment: Possibly the last Derelict beer I’ll have on tap. Great work from Altitude and Derelict. Very easy drinking hop forward hazy. Going down a treat.

beer.beer_description:
2024 edition is here. This year we have teamed up with the legends at Derelict brewing. 
Here you have an Oat Cream pale ale. Smooth, creamy and fruity with just enough bite to keep pouring it down.

This beer is brewed every year with the help of Gladfield malt, Clayton hops, Konvoy kegs, Froth tech yeast and Smiths Craft Beer House. All profits made are donated to different hospitality scholars.

user.bio: I do not want friends who don't comment when they check beers in. Please! Check ins without comment are boring.
Beer Beer and more Beer the only way to be

beer.beer_description: Judged best dark ale in NZ at the 2022 Brewers guild awards, our take on the classic export style is  named for the dark sky reserve around the mackenzie basin. One of the worlds best spots for stargazing, this beer is best enjoyed on a wintery evening whilst partaking in some shooting star spotting. A pitch black pour with a tight tan head reveals an abundance of complex coffee, chocolate and caramelized sugar aromas that meld with roasted grains and some wood char. Light and creamy are the first impressions in your mouth; Giving way to a balance of coffee and campfire roast marshmallows and washed clean with a dryness and long roasty bitterness thats classic of the style.

items.badge_name: Beyond a Shadow of a Stout (Level 45)
items.badge_description: We all love Stouts, and now we have a dedicated badge to celebrate your dedication to these dark, top-fermented beer in multiple variations, like Oatmeal, Milk and more! Which one will you start with? That's 225 different beers with the style of Stout. Try 5 more for Level 46!

beer.beer_description: With so many hop heavy hazy IPA's taking the descriptor of pineapple we thought why not boost this with actual pineapple. Nothing better than the real thing for making flavour and aroma! We took a nice, light and sweet malt base with plenty of creamy oats and a bit of lactose and created a hazy IPA by stuffing it full of pineapplely hops. Nectaron, citra and simcoe. Then when it wasn't quite finished we then stuffed it with 15kg of Freeze dried pineapple - equivalet to 150kg of fresh pineapple! Pouring a beautiful light yellow colour with a clean haze, this beer is juice-centric and has plenty of tangy pineapple flowing out mixed in with some stonefruit and pine notes. A full body, lots of fruit flavour and a mellow bitterness round out the flavour.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 95 check-ins with a photo.

beer.beer_description: Having the opportunity to collaborate with Freestyle Hop Farms is a no-brainer. These guys are at the forefront of not only NZ's, but the worlds hop growing and breeding. So when they release a new variety its kind of a must have. Bringing the idea of a west coast pilsner to life this new variety named Peacherine brings a vibrant and lively stonefruit edge to their other new kid on the block which is liquid Nelson Sauvin and the combo is mind blowing. The beer itself is light and fresh to drink with a balanced even bitterness and a monster aroma of stonefruit, citrus and white grape.

beer.beer_name: DDH Bill Us For the Damages [NZ Brewed]
beer.beer_description: DDH (double dry hopped) NEIPA colab with the wicked people at Northern Monk from Leeds, UK. A thick and aromatic brew that reaches a new level of juiciness. Named after a highly contested game of tap room cricket got a little out of hand on brew day.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 295 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 60! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: Part two of our dual release with Alvarado St brewery is the other end of the drinking spectrum to the first. Pushing the boat out with a triple dry hop load of freshly harvested Eggers hops that we hand selected during the Nelson harvest. We have fused these with some Nelson Sauvin and Citra for classic back up rockstar hops and a kiss of our new favourite HBC 586. At over 8% the medium is big rich and pillowy to deliver this triple dry hop load.
beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy

beer.beer_description:
Is it the weekend? It's time for peak performance, whatever that means. Maybe a sofa start followed by a casual lift lap or even a doggy trail run. The goal is 'most fun wins' whatever you're up to. 
A backbone of new Amplifire™️ morphed Motueka, cryo-enhanced Simcoe and the best Nelson Sauvin we could find make up a hop bill that hits all the right spots. Pop these on a comfy sofa of lean, clean and smooth malts that don't get in the way of all that hopping and you have the weekend athlete mode enabled. 
Whatever your weekend activity - own it!

Our flagship IPA and now 2017 gold medalist making it the South Islands top IPA for the 4th year running.
Named after the most intelligent bird in the world, our native Kea, this is a balanced, vibrant and characterful beer just like its namesake.
The beer is a complex hybrid of New World hop-forward and old-English toasty IPA styles for a balanced and sessionable finish.

Session NEIPA. 
Crafted to keep all the full bodied juiciness of a full NEIPA but at a sessionable abv.
Riwaka, Mosaic, Citra and Waimea.

One of our most awarded beers and currently the top Wheat beer in the NZ! This beer was inspired by a trip to the continent of wheat driven styles. 
This is fundamentally a traditional Bavarian wheat beer but our take, whilst being true to its origins, has our own twist with a mix of local and imported ingredients. This mix stacks the beer with that distinct Euro flavour and delivers that authentic frothy head. The finished beer is un-fined and un-filtered so roll bottles gently for your cloudy drinking pleasure.

Crisp and refreshing like a snowball to the face only much more enjoyable. 
With a 2017 silver medal to its name amongst others this beer is a mash up of styles that shows a classic Euro pils profile that has been hopped with NZ Saaz varietals. Fruit drizzled with lemon to smell and a crisp clean palate to slake the thirst.

Our multi awarded Lager is lighter in alcohol yet still full of rich local malt flavours. Named after the local legends that once toiled for years in the heat looking for gold. This beer will be appreciated by the hot and bothered as well as 5-Star Beer Geeks. A blend of several malts and a light hop touch define a very clean and dry yet flavourful beer. Much more interesting than a standard Lager but still super refreshing.

Eliott's favourite recipe and holder of many beer awards (including gold).  This brew shows off it's British roots, not just in terms of the style but also its point of difference. A slightly sweet stout base delivers fresh roast coffee, dark chocolate and molasses flavours. The addition of a small amount of peated distiller's malt gives off a heady, complex whisky nose that works to balance it all out.

When it came to settle on our Pale Ale recipe, the trendy thing is to pack them full of imported or exciting new ‘fruity hop’ varieties. We tend not to be swayed by fashions down here in Otago, so we took a step back and let the strength of traditional Kiwi brewing do its thing.
With local and international medals to its name the idea here is that you get the full flavour of NZ’s traditional hop and malt varietals with a burst of youthful vigour.

Created by the dirtbags at the local moutainbike club this beer is ideal post a two wheeled adventure. These singletrack minded individuals decided what they wanted brewed which was a beer big enough for some serious flavour, small enough to have a couple, crisp enough for some thirst control and hoppy enough for even the smallest nose. Delivering on the above is a clean and mildly malty red ale hopped up with classic US varieties for orange, pine and dried fig aromas and a solid bitterness.

Our house hazy IPA is the quintessential form of the modern craft favourite. First brewed waaay back in 2018 and refined over the years to stay in tune with new hops and yeasts and always at the cutting edge of the style. Like your bad fitting goggles on a powder day this beer is foggy in the glass to look at due to the big dose of Kiwi and American hops. Driven by one of our favourite new varieties, HBC 586 and backed up by classic heavy hitters mosaic, motueka and citra. This delivers classic punchy tropical fruits, oodles of pineapple, peach and rock melon.  A glowing pale yellow to look at the beer is smooth, full bodied and aroma forward with just enough bitterness and a lasting deliciousness.

The classic celebration - stereotyped with Americans but practiced the world over. Just like the classic APA. We have brewed our simply and classically with no fussy messing around - like a high five should be. Its point of difference is the new hops of the block: Talus and Mosaic. Result - A balanced and sessionable ale with plenty of flavour. Soft citrus and floral aromas with a hint of tropicality. Fresh bitterness and a lovely biscuity edge.

Life's too short to take the motorway. We say, enjoy your journey and always take the Scenic Route. It's the same with beer - each one is special so take the time to savour it. This NZ IPA is like a long drive along the west coast, beautiful and classically Kiwi with clean green pungent hop aromas. A clear gold pour takes the journey to a subtle clean maltiness, a smooth feature packed palate with an assertive bitterness to round off the trip.

The final product of our Aurora pale ale trial is this - our house pale ale.  Straw in colour, lots of bright fruit and citrus aromas jump out to define this modern take on the style. Smooth and crisp with a light bitterness rounding out the palate.

beer.beer_name: Ik Ben Gruit - Chardonnay Barrel-Aged Belgian Gruit
beer.beer_style: Historical Beer - Gruit / Ancient Herbed Ale
beer.beer_description: Gruit is an ancient style of beer originating from when beer was flavoured with a spice or herb blend, rather than hops. For our version, we have partially soured some of the beer blended it back together then used immense amounts of juniper, lavender and fresh fruit pulp. Finally we aged it in Chardonnay barrels for 4 months for some depth and complexity. It shows Floral lavender nose, with a spicy juniper palate balanced with sweet fruit. Hint of sourness gives length and dry chardonnay finish. Brewed for #GABS2018.

With so many hop heavy hazy IPA's taking the descriptor of pineapple we thought why not boost this with actual pineapple. Nothing better than the real thing for making flavour and aroma! We took a nice, light and sweet malt base with plenty of creamy oats and a bit of lactose and created a hazy IPA by stuffing it full of pineapplely hops. Nectaron, citra and simcoe. Then when it wasn't quite finished we then stuffed it with 15kg of Freeze dried pineapple - equivalet to 150kg of fresh pineapple! Pouring a beautiful light yellow colour with a clean haze, this beer is juice-centric and has plenty of tangy pineapple flowing out mixed in with some stonefruit and pine notes. A full body, lots of fruit flavour and a mellow bitterness round out the flavour.

Following our well received collab with ZenKuro sake brewery in 2019 we have teamed up again, this time with a different approach. Sake bomb beer in one neat package...Not quite - but we have brewed a beautiful golden pilsner with locally grown southland hops and then re-fermented it with sake kasu (rice starch by product of sake production). Making a lovely easy going beer that pairs well with japanese food and contains subtle aromas of rice wine matched with stonefruit. Just remember your chant before drinking!

Just like you see in the cartoons, you will notice wild seeded pine trees growing out sideways from the cliff faces round here. Brewed exclusively for Skyline Gondola this beer brings awareness to these pine tree pests and donations from sales go to helping control them.
Very dry brew with a new world hop punch.

Double the Kea double the fun. It's our gold medal-winning Mischievous Kea but with twice the mischief! Cloudy, soft pillowy bitterness with a rich body and balanced yet intense Hop profile. 

Our entry for the 2018 NZIPA Challenge at Smith's Craft Beer House in Queenstown.

The desert that every restaurant should have – because if it’s on the menu then you have to get one. It’s the rules. Belgian brown ale brewed with candi syrups, aged on dates and vanilla then finished with lashings of caramel to sweeten up your day.

Come and ride the magic carpet, that glorious belt of black rubber that actually takes you longer than walking to get to the top...let it take over your senses, as you fly over the desert and sip beer with Aladdin on your way to Ali Baba and his 40 thieves. However you dont have to imagine too hard to see the soft golden haze this beer pours or to smell the all around medley of an arabian tropical fruit platter that's backed with fresh strawberries and hints of stonefruit teasing you into that first sip. A balanced, creamy medium-full body and tangy, dancing fruit driven flavours meet the senses here and send you off leaving you wanting another magic carpet ride.

Judged best dark ale in NZ at the 2022 Brewers guild awards.
Whether you dance like Bernard Black, Manny or perhaps Johnny Castle - here in Queenstown we all have our secret boogie superstition when snow season comes.

First brewed for our mates 40th birthday celebrations we liked it so much we decided to release it. This beer is piney, orangey and caramelly to smell with a full but crisp body some malty sweetness and a long finish.

Cheerful Mayhem, kinda sounds like our brewery a little bit... Also sounds kinda like a classic Irish pub. Ruaille Buaille or Cheerful Mayhem - released just in time for the annual celebration of St Patrick. Where this particular brand of cheerful mayhem can be found in abundance all around the world. Perfect on Nitro and delicious otherwise is this dark black pour with subtle aromas of toasted grains, dark chocolate and roasting coffee. A soft and easy drinking mouthfeel with a medium body and a balancing roastiness and minimal bitterness. Raise one to Patrick and be cheerful.

beer.beer_style: Historical Beer - Gruit / Ancient Herbed Ale
beer.beer_description: Gruit is an ancient style of beer originating from when beer was flavoured with a spice or herb blend, rather than hops. For our version, we have partially soured some of the beer blended it back together then used immense amounts of juniper, lavender and fresh fruit pulp. Finally we aged it in Chardonnay barrels for 4 months for some depth and complexity. It shows Floral lavender nose, with a spicy juniper palate balanced with sweet fruit. Hint of sourness gives length and dry chardonnay finish.

Altitude Brewing X Birkenhead Brewing Co (BBC) collaboration - Ding Ding Round 2!
In 2018, Altitude and BBC met for a duel in Queenstown putting their best beer forward people to choose. The people spoke, it was a tie!
This knockout APA weighs in on the best creativity, bringing a snappy APA that packs a sweet punch with backbone. With medium bitterness, we've put the power in with dank Mosaic hops and a 4x2 pine punch with Waimea. Talus hops then make you giddy with a fruit and citrus wallop.

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description: The return of the king. Not a LOTR reference but another mountain deity, the ridiculous mountain goats that live in the alps. It been a minute since we made this beer that was first brewed for beervana 2019 - and we have refined it into beverage fit for a king. Our house double finds that sweet spot to match huge flavours with a dangerous drinkability. At 25 grams per litre of Citra, Strata, Riwaka and Sabro added over three dry additions you get huge tropical passion and stone fruit with a hint of citrus to balance the palate. The mouthfeel is soft and lush but retains a level of dryness to enhance the drinkability of such a big beer.
